page.title: 12Shopping in Eccles 1
page.content: Eccles, like many small towns, has a shopping precinct. It contains one large supermarket and a variety of other shops supplying goods that people need every day. It has a 'Boots' chemist, a number of confectioners, greengrocers, butchers and wallpaper shops, a television shop and a furniture shop. On the edge of the precinct is Church St. This is pedestrianised and has a number of shops similar to those on the precinct. One shop is on the site of the shop where Eccles Cakes were invented. The Woolworth store has now closed. At the bottom end of Church St. is the Market Cross and there is an open market on the corner of Regent Rd. which opens on Thursdays and Saturdays. It sells cheap clothing, greengroceries, fancy goods, fish and poultry, etc.
